page.title: 13RURAL SETTLEMENT:TEST VALLEY
page.content: This is mainly a rural area with very few settlements,except for 13 scattered farms.Many of thes are part of Broadlands Estate and are managed by it.The farm houses and cottages are often very attractive and some of them are very old.Some are thatched.Newer houses are found beside the A31.There are some very large houses built between Victorian times and today, which stand in extensive wooded grounds.New houses are being built. People who live here probably commute to Winchester or Southampton. There is only one small village,which lies on the A36.Wigley shares its amenities with Ower,just to the south, where there is a shop and post office. The houses vary in age:Wigley Manor is old.The village may have lost some of its importance since the M27 bypass was built.
